org.mxupdate.plugin
Class Update_mxJPO

java.lang.Object
  org.mxupdate.plugin.AbstractPlugin_mxJPO
      org.mxupdate.plugin.Update_mxJPO

public class Update_mxJPO
extends AbstractPlugin_mxJPO

The JPO class is the plug-in to create or update configuration items defined through given MX update files.

Version:
$Id: Update_mxJPO.java 780 2010-04-06 11:22:55Z tim.moxter $
Author:
The MxUpdate Team

mxMain

@Deprecated
public void mxMain(matrix.db.Context _context,
                              String... _args)
            throws Exception
Deprecated. 

Depreciated because only used from old Eclipse plug-in.

Parameters:
_context - MX context for this request
_args - first index of the arguments defined the file to update
Throws:
Exception - if the update failed

updateByName

@Deprecated
public String updateByName(matrix.db.Context _context,
                                      String[] _args)
                    throws Exception
Deprecated. 

Updates MX Update files depending on file names. The method is used from the MX Update Eclipse Plug-In if the MxUpdate Update Deployment tool has access to the files from the Eclipse Plug-In.

Parameters:
_context - MX context for this request
_args - encoded arguments from the Eclipse plug-in:
  • Set<String>
    set of file names which must be updated
  • Boolean
    if set to true all included JPOs are compiled; otherwise no JPOs are compiled. Default is not to compile (false)
Returns:
logging information from the update
Throws:
Exception - if the update failed
See Also:
updateFiles(ParameterCache_mxJPO, Set, boolean)

updateByContent

@Deprecated
public String updateByContent(matrix.db.Context _context,
                                         String[] _args)
                       throws Exception
Deprecated. 

Updates the files depending on the file name with related file content. The method is used from the MX Update Eclipse Plug-In if the MxUpdate Update Deployment tool has NO access to the files from the Eclipse Plug-In (e.g. if a virtual machine is used, or MX is located on a server).

Parameters:
_context - MX context for this request
_args - encoded arguments from the Eclipse plug-in:
  • Map<String,String>
    map of the file name and the related file content which must be updated
  • Boolean
    if set to true all included JPOs are compiled; otherwise no JPOs are compiled. Default is not to compile (false)
Returns:
logging information from the update
Throws:
Exception - if the update failed
See Also:
updateFiles(ParameterCache_mxJPO, Set, boolean)

updateFiles

protected String updateFiles(ParameterCache_mxJPO _paramCache,
                             Set<File> _files,
                             boolean _compile)
                      throws Exception
Updates all configurations items specified through given set of MX update files.

Parameters:
_paramCache - predefined parameters with MX context
_files - set of all files to update
_compile - if true related JPOs are compiled; if false no JPOs are compiled
Returns:
logging information from the update
Throws:
Exception - if update for the _files failed

evalInstances

protected Map<TypeDef_mxJPO,Map<File,String>> evalInstances(ParameterCache_mxJPO _paramCache,
                                                            Set<File> _files)
                                                     throws Exception
Evaluates depending on the file (names) related MX type definition instances.

Parameters:
_paramCache - parameter cache with MX context
_files - set with all files
Returns:
map with the files and depending MX type definition instance
Throws:
Exception - if instances could not be evaluated
